Article.ArticleTitle: Reaction of 2-propanol with ozone in aqueous media.

AbstractText: This paper deals with reactions occurring in the aqueous system of 2-propanol/ozone. The considered reactions are discussed from thermodynamic and kinetic points of view. The major finding refers to the fact that 2-propanol reacts with O<sub>3</sub> mainly via hydride transfer: (HO)(H<sub>3</sub>C)<sub>2</sub>CH + O<sub>3</sub> → [(HO)(H<sub>3</sub>C)<sub>2</sub>C<sup>+</sup> + HO<sub>3</sub><sup>-</sup>]<sub>cage</sub> → (HO)(H<sub>3</sub>C)<sub>2</sub>C<sup>+</sup> + HO<sub>3</sub><sup>-</sup> → (H<sub>3</sub>C)<sub>2</sub>CO + H<sub>2</sub>O + O<sub>2</sub> Arguments supporting this proposed mechanism are: high exergonicity of reaction (ΔG = -234 kJ mol<sup>-1</sup> for the first two steps), low HO yield - (2.4 ± 0.5)% and high acetone yield - (87.2 ± 1.5)%. Other oxidation products detected within the system are acetaldehyde - (1.4 ± 0.1)%, formaldehyde - (4.0 ± 0.1)%, acetic acid - (2.8 ± 0.2)%, formic acid - (0.6 ± 0.2)% and hydrogen peroxide - (1.5 ± 0.1)%. The temperature dependence of the second order rate constant for the reaction 2-propanol + O<sub>3</sub> → products is ln k<sub>II</sub> = 29.64-8500 × T<sup>-1</sup>. The activation energy and pre-exponential factor derived from this relationship are (71 ± 3) kJ mol<sup>-1</sup> and (7.5 ± 6.4) × 10<sup>12</sup> M<sup>-1</sup> s<sup>-1</sup>, respectively. At 23 °C, the second order rate constant is k<sub>II</sub> = (2.7 ± 0.1) M<sup>-1</sup> s<sup>-1</sup>. The low reaction rate can be explained by the transfer of one hydride ion from 2-propanol to electrophilic ozone.
